intro: Iris petrana, commonly known as the Persian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions. Iris petrana is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been cultivated for centuries in gardens and botanical collections.
